troubleshooting.intro: Having issues? Find answers to common problems below.
troubleshooting.q1: I accidentally awarded a point to the wrong team
troubleshooting.a1: Use the Undo button (or press Z) to reverse the last action. You can undo multiple times if needed. Then award the point to the correct team.
troubleshooting.q2: The score is wrong - how do I fix it?
troubleshooting.a2: Go to Menu → Manual Changes → Edit Current Set Score. You can manually adjust both team scores. For historical sets, use Edit All Sets.
troubleshooting.q3: I need to undo multiple actions
troubleshooting.a3: Click the Undo button repeatedly. Each click reverses one action. The undo history is preserved until the set ends.
troubleshooting.q4: Match ended but I made a mistake
troubleshooting.a4: On the Match End screen, click "Reopen Last Set" to go back to scoring mode. Note: this will clear all collected signatures.
troubleshooting.q5: Why can't my libero enter the court?
troubleshooting.a5: Check: (1) The target position must be back-row (I, V, or VI), (2) A point must be awarded since the last libero action, (3) The libero isn't marked as "unable to play".
troubleshooting.a6: A point must be awarded between libero exchanges. Also, check that neither libero is marked as unable to play.
troubleshooting.q7: How do I redesignate a libero?
troubleshooting.a7: Go to Menu → Libero → Redesignate Libero. Select the reason (injury, declared, etc.) and choose a new player from the bench to become the new libero.
troubleshooting.q8: Why can't I substitute this player?
troubleshooting.a8: Substitution rules apply: (1) Max 6 regular substitutions per set, (2) A player can only substitute for the same player they replaced, (3) A player just subbed out cannot return in the same rally.
troubleshooting.q9: We've used all 6 substitutions - what now?
troubleshooting.a9: Once all 6 substitutions are used, no more regular substitutions are allowed. Exceptional substitutions (for injury/expulsion) may still be possible using the libero or a player who hasn't entered the set.
troubleshooting.q10: Player was expelled - how to substitute?
troubleshooting.a10: An exceptional substitution modal will appear. You can substitute with any eligible bench player, even if it wouldn't normally be allowed.
troubleshooting.q11: App shows "Offline" - what do I do?
troubleshooting.a11: Don't worry! The app works offline. All data is saved locally and will sync when you're back online. Continue scoring normally.
troubleshooting.q12: Changes aren't syncing to the cloud
troubleshooting.a12: Check the connection status indicator. If offline, data will sync when reconnected. You can also go to Menu → Options → manually trigger sync from the Cloud Backup section.
troubleshooting.a13: Ensure: (1) Both devices are on the same WiFi network, (2) The dashboard server is running (check Options), (3) The correct PIN is entered, (4) Firewall isn't blocking the connection.
troubleshooting.q14: App crashed - how do I recover the match?
troubleshooting.a14: On the Home screen, click "Continue Match" if the match is still in progress. If that doesn't work, use "Restore Match" to recover from the latest backup.
troubleshooting.q15: How do I restore from a backup?
troubleshooting.a15: Go to Home → Restore Match. Choose either Cloud Backup (enter Game # and PIN) or Local Backup (select a .json backup file from your device).
troubleshooting.a16: For official matches, use "Restore Match" with the Game PIN. For test matches, you'll need a local backup file if available. Enable auto-backup to prevent future data loss.
